Definition: Area of land devoted to growing crops for consumption, export, and industrial use. Does not include pastures.
Flooded lands are areas that are consistently inundated with fresh, brackish, and salt water (e.g., lakes, reservoirs, etc.). These can be used to represent land loss from sea level rise.
Forested land covered in mangroves or other partially inundated trees.
Area of land covered in primary forest.
Area of land covered in secondary forest, including plantations
Area of unmanaged grasslands, including native praries, steppe, and savanna.
Other land use categories, including permanent snow and glaciers, barren land, sand dunes, etc.
Pastures are managed grasslands used for grazing.
Area of land devoted to urban/suburban development. Assume no emissions from land use (primary emissions captured elsewhere).
Shrublands, including scrublands, chapparal, and maquis; lands with some sequestration in perennial woody biomass, but without uses for forestry or grazing.
Wetlands, which emit :math:`\text{CH}_4`. Include wetlands, swamps, marshes, etc.
